newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Mining Corp Target eye merger.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Mining Corp Target eye merger.

text.p: Mining Corp of Australia Ltd and Target Resources of Australia NL (MGC) said on Tuesday they propose to merge.
Under a scheme of arrangement, Target shareholders would be offered one ordinary share in MGC for every eight shares in Target.

A merger would in part make available significant funds to to continue development of Target's Selsinsing gold mine in Malaysia as well as other Malaysian projects, the companies said in a joint statement.
Target's interests lie mainly in Malaysia, while MGC's activities centre mainly on the Black Flag gold tenements in Western Australia.
MGC has a market capitalisation of about A$13.2 million. Target's market capitalisation is around A$25.6 million.
MGC shares were trading eight cents higher at A$0.80 while Target shares were one cent higher at A$0.96 cents in late trading on the Australian Stock Exchange.
